title.value: Transposable elements regulate thymus development and function
title.justification: The title is taken directly from the original document.
title.quote: Transposable elements regulate thymus development and function

extractions.description: The paper explores the role of transposable elements (TEs) in T-cell development within the thymus, particularly focusing on their expression in various thymic cell types such as medullary thymic epithelial cells (mTECs) and plasmacytoid dendritic cells (pDCs). Through multi-omic analyses, it investigates how TEs interact with transcription factors, contribute to the immunopeptidome, and vary with age and cell lineage, proposing that regulated TE expression is crucial for preventing autoimmunity.

type.justification: The paper presents experimental evidence through multi-omic analyses, cell enrichment processes, RNA sequencing, and mass spectrometry to explore the expression and impact of TEs in thymic cells.
type.quote: To evaluate the role of TEs in thymopoiesis, we adopted a multipronged strategy beginning with scRNA-seq of human thymi and culminating in MS analyses of the MAP repertoire of mouse mTECs.

name.justification: The focus of the paper is on the immune system, specifically T-cell development in the thymus and the regulatory roles of transposable elements in various thymic cell types.
name.quote: Transposable elements regulate thymus development and function

name.justification: The study uses genomic techniques like scRNA-seq and explores TE sequences in thymic cells.
name.quote: scRNA-seq of human thymi and culminating in MS analyses of the MAP repertoire of mouse mTECs.

name.justification: The paper involves mass spectrometry (MS) analyses to identify MHC-associated peptides derived from TEs.
The dataset is referenced for scRNA-seq data from human thymi.
name.quote: we quantified the expression of 809 TE subfamilies...in the scRNA-seq dataset created by Park et al.

referenced_paper_title.justification: Directly mentioned as being used in the study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: in the scRNA-seq dataset created by Park et al.

name.justification: This dataset is referenced for scRNA-seq data from murine thymi.
name.quote: scRNA-seq data from Baran-Gale et al.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The authors reference it directly for scRNA-seq data.
referenced_paper_title.quote: scRNA-seq data from Baran-Gale et al.

name.justification: Referenced for differential expression analysis of TE subfamilies between thymic and splenic pDCs.
name.quote: scRNA-seq data from human spleens published by Madissoon et al. (60)
